ygData.subject: RE: [neat] Help with XOR? :(
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually, depending on your perspective, both of you are correct. If a hidden node is limited to one input and one output it takes two hidden nodes for XOR.

------=_NextPart_000_0040_01C83F0B.9FE51600
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Actually, depending on your perspective, both of you are correct.
 
If a hidden node is limited to one input and one output it takes two hidden
nodes for XOR.  However mutex nodes of multiple inputs can handle XOR
internally.  
 
This is what almost destroyed AI in the early years, and indeed set it back
decades.
 
Ken
 



  _____  

From: neat@yahoogroups.com [mailto:neat@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Stephen Waits
Sent: Saturday, December 15, 2007 10:59 AM
To: neat@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [neat] Help with XOR? :(




On Dec 15, 2007, at 9:13 AM, Colin Green wrote:

> I've got a vague memory of XOR requiring two hidden nodes.

Binary XOR only requires a single hidden node.
--
Stephen Waits
steve@waits. <mailto:steve%40waits.net> net
http://swaits. <http://swaits.com/> com/
